required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Efficacy and Safety of F520 in Patients With Relapsed/Refractory Peripheral T Cell Lymphoma (PTCL).
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Open-label, Single-arm, Multicenter Study of the Efficacy and Safety of F520 in Relapsed/Refractory Peripheral T Cell Lymphoma (PTCL).

lead_sponsor.agency: Shandong New Time Pharmaceutical Co., LTD

clinical_study.source: Shandong New Time Pharmaceutical Co., LTD

brief_summary.textblock: It is a multi-center, prospective, open-label, two-stage optimized design, single-arm, phase II clinical study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of F520 for the treatment of relapsed and refractory peripheral T cell lymphoma (PTCL), and to evaluate the immunogenicity of F520.

primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of F520 as defined by objective response rate (evaluated by IRC) in patients with relapsed or refractory PTCL.

secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of F520 as defined by objective response rate (evaluated by investigator) in patients with relapsed or refractory PTCL.
To evaluate the efficacy of F520 as defined by completed response rate (evaluated by investigator/IRC) in patients with relapsed or refractory PTCL.
To evaluate the duration of response (DOR) of F520 in patients with relapsed or refractory PTCL.
To evaluate the duration from the first administration to death because of any reason in patients with relapsed or refractory PTCL.
To evaluate the efficacy of F520 as defined by progression-free survival, in patients with relapsed or refractory PTCL.
To evaluate the efficacy of F520 as defined by disease control rate, in patients with relapsed or refractory PTCL.
To evaluate the efficacy of F520 as defined by time to response in patients with relapsed or refractory PTCL.
